content: How can I help you today?

I've just been really stressed and not sleeping well. My partner thought it would be helpful to talk to someone, but honestly, I don’t know if this will make a difference. I’m just overwhelmed, especially with work and everything at home.

That sounds like a lot to handle—work, home, and the stress affecting your sleep. It can be hard to see how things might change when everything feels overwhelming. What’s been weighing on you the most lately?

I think it’s mostly work. I’ve been so worried about getting fired. The company isn’t doing great, and I feel like I might be one of the first to go if layoffs happen. It’s all I can think about, and it’s keeping me up at night.

It sounds like the uncertainty at work and the fear of losing your job have really been eating away at you, and it's affecting your ability to rest and recharge. It's understandable that this situation would feel overwhelming. What do you think has helped you handle stress in the past, if anything?

Honestly, I don't know. I used to handle stress better before all this, but now it just feels constant. At night, I use my phone to distract myself, but that only seems to make things worse. It's like I can't shut my brain off.

It sounds like you're really stuck in a cycle—using distractions to cope, but it leaves you feeling even more drained. It must be tough not to find relief from the constant stress. Have you thought about what might make nights, or even days, feel a bit easier?
I’ve thought about it, but honestly, I don’t know where to start. Everything feels so overwhelming that I don’t even know what would help. It’s like I’m just stuck in this loop.

Feeling stuck in that loop can make it really hard to see a way forward, especially when the stress keeps piling up. It’s understandable to feel unsure about where to begin—it’s a lot. What do you think is most important for you to feel better right now?

I guess just finding a way to feel less overwhelmed would help. If I could actually sleep at night, maybe I could handle things better during the day. Being able to stay calm and think clearly would make a huge difference.

Getting restful sleep and finding calm could really help ease that overwhelm and allow you to tackle things more clearly. Even just one step in that direction could make a difference. What do you think might be a small, manageable change you could start with?
Maybe cutting back on how much I'm on my phone at night. I know it isn't helping, but it's just hard to stop when my mind is racing. I honestly don’t know if I can stick to it, though.

That's a thoughtful idea—cutting back on phone use could be a good start for calming your mind before bed. It sounds like you’re feeling unsure about whether you can follow through. What do you think might make it easier to take that first step?

Maybe I could try putting my phone in another room at night or setting a time to turn it off. It’ll be hard, though, because it’s sort of my go-to when I feel anxious. I’ll probably need to find something else to do instead.

That’s a great approach—creating some physical distance from your phone or setting a time to turn it off could help break the habit. Finding something else comforting to do when you’re feeling anxious sounds like it could make it more manageable, too. Is there anything that comes to mind that you might enjoy or find soothing?

Maybe reading a book, or even just listening to some calming music. I’m not sure it’ll help as much as the phone does, but it might be worth a try. I’d just have to figure out what would actually help me unwind.

It’s thoughtful that you're considering reading or listening to calming music—they sound like gentle alternatives that might help you wind down in a healthier way. Trying them out could be a good first step to see what works for you. Is this something you'd feel ready to explore, or is there anything else you'd like to talk through first?
I think I’m okay to end the conversation. Thank you for speaking about this with me.
